availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles G. Graham (Franklin County, Kentucky, merchant and livery stable)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, merchant and livery stable. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah A. Graham. Father of Alice Graham, William Graham, and Sally Graham. Married to Mary T. Graham. Father of Carrie Graham and Page Graham. Resident of Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned seven enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1840. Merchant in Franklin County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Livery stable owner in Franklin County in 1860. Owned twenty-seven enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort City, p. 329.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 31A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 249.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 490B.
